<div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM Food &amp; Beverage (F&amp;B) is the prime partner for food producers that want to bring their product to the next level. At F&amp;B, leverage our knowledge in taste, texture and health to bring complete solutions that can feed the world in a sustainable way.\n   <br> The Yeast Production Plant (YPP) in Delft is one of the oldest and largest production facilities for yeast extracts in the world. It produces a portfolio of ingredients that are used to modulate taste, based on proprietary yeast strains. The plant is fully loaded (100% occupation; 7 days a week, 24 hours\u002Fday) and demand\u002Fsupply needs to be closely balanced. To stay a sustainable profitable business continuous improvements are needed.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   At the YPP, the Improve Plant department is responsible for the selection, development, and implementation of all value-adding projects. They work in close alignment with various stakeholders. Currently, major projects are getting off the ground with the aim to upgrade key parts of the plant and improve the sustainability footprint of the site.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The Improve Plant team has an opening for a\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Process Technologist<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   As a Process Technologist, you will be bringing both incremental and radical improvements from concept to production.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Identify, rank and lead improvement opportunities (e.g. capacity extension, cost reduction, energy reduction), quality and yield improvements;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support the introduction and transfer of new products or processes (developed by R&amp;D) to a manufacturing environment;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bridge between many departments (manufacturing, supply chain, QA, SHE, R&amp;D, project engineering, plant management team and the business) Able to effectively communicate at all levels;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>As a technologist for the fermentation facility, you will focus on the operations in this sections as your core area of expertise, as well as acting as a linking pin between downstream process, quality and business.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The opportunity to shape the yeast production plant for the future, in line with ambitious targets of DSM Food &amp; Beverage;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supportive team that is not afraid to think outside the box;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Highly diverse environment where you interact on various levels;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A good Collective Labour Agreement and competitive salary;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>25 paid holidays plus budget to buy additionally up to 13 extra holidays;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Based on your experience we will offer you a base salary of € 46,000 to € 65,000 per year (including holiday allowance and 13th month) and extra benefits, such as 25 holiday days, a bonus, the option to buy more holiday days with a 6% my choice budget and much more.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>MSc degree in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Food Technology or Biotechnology;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Some practical experience in industrial scale fermentation processes;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge of bioprocess data processing. Proficient in use of excel, Aspen Plus and\u002For other data analysis tools;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>As you will be closely cooperating with and learning on the job from one of our fermentation experts, this role is ideal situated for graduates or technologists in their early careers;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to combine problem analysis with practical judgement and creativity with high standard for safety and quality;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Team player attitude, ability to thrive in an ambiguous environment and communicate effectively with fellow professionals, at various levels within the organization;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collaborative, entrepreneurial, proactive, responsible, result-orientated, and flexible attitude;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good communication skills (written and verbal) in English (proficiency in Dutch is an advantage).<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   No matter which team you are on, at DSM you’ll be part of a powerful shared purpose – to create brighter lives for all. Together, we’ll understand the needs of every customer and offer solutions that promote their success and impact, today and in the future.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM Biomedical is the world’s unrivaled biomaterials expert and committed partner in driving sustainable innovation in healthcare. For more than 30 years, the company has been at the forefront of biomaterial science and process innovation, and the leading resource for global medical device and pharmaceutical companies.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The Project Manager position at DSM is an exciting opportunity to lead multidisciplinary project teams through gates and milestones. The role provides the exposure to different medical device and material technologies, connects with all levels of team members, and has visibility throughout the organization. The role is part of a strong Project Management Office group using the backing of established procedures and data driven PM tools.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   As a Project Manager you will be responsible for the integrated management of the full project lifecycle, process improvement initiatives, cost saving projects, and\u002For new business development projects as assigned while developing and managing partnerships with internal and external stakeholders. The next key tasks are handled by the Project Manager:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Generating project plans and ensuring that the project deliverables and milestones are met.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Managing projects in terms of money, time, escalating scope changes, resource needs, quality and information\u002Fcommunication.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Managing multiple projects or initiatives based on scope, complexity, and timelines (small to large scale projects).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensuring compliance of project team members with DSM Biomedical quality system requirements. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensuring a safe, healthy, and injury-free work environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reporting the progress of the project versus the project plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Managing the risks related to the project and inform the appropriate authorities in case project objectives, milestones, quality, timing and\u002For budget incur risk.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Indirectly managing the project team members, create teambuilding and team spirit.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The opportunity to be of great added value to our business, customers, employees and overall DSM.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>An inclusive and multicultural team with respect for everyone.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A dynamic work environment with many challenges that give you the possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions. You are giving the freedom to be creative and proactive.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Based on your experience we will offer you a base salary of 70k to 100k per year (including holiday allowance and 13th month) and extra benefits, such as 25 holiday days, a bonus, the option to buy more holiday days with a 6% my choice budget and much more.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor’s degree required, MBA desirable.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum 3 years of broad experience managing multi-disciplinary projects or teams to successful business outcomes, including documented evidence of applying project management best practices required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Project management experience in a technical function\u002Ffield required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrated leadership skills, and respected communication abilities with all levels of the organization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrated negotiation skills, influence skills, conflict resolution skills, initiative, and drive.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Project management experience in medical device strongly preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Project Management Professional (PMP®) Certification from the Project Management Institute (PMI) a plus.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Required travel of up to 10%.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   No matter which team you are on, at DSM you’ll be part of a powerful shared purpose – to create brighter lives for all. You’ll get opportunities to work collaboratively with different departments and industry experts to make a positive difference to the future of millions of people and the planet we all share. Together, we’ll understand the needs of every customer and offer solutions that promote their success and impact, today and in the future.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Breng je passie mee. Bouw de toekomst.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Ben jij hands-on, een teamplayer en wil jij onderdeel zijn van organisatie die sustainability als een van hun bedrijfsresultaten heeft staan?\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM Food &amp; Bevearage is de werelds grootste aanbieder van voedsel enzymen, culturen, smaak en gezondheids ingredienten. Het Gist Productie Bedrijf (GPB) is de grootste fabriek wereldwijd voor gistextracten en maakt gebruik van geautomatiseerde batch processen. De processtappen bestaan o.a. uit fermentatie, centrifuge, autolyse, destillatie, indampen, decanteren, filtratie en sproeidrogen. Daarnaast voorziet het GPB de site van utiliteitsvoorzieningen zoals stoom, elektra, lucht en water. Er is een bijproduct dat wordt verwerkt naar veevoeder.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Binnen het GPB, zal jij samen met je collega operators in je ploeg, verantwoordelijk zijn voor zowel de productieprocessen als de utiliteitsvoorzieningen. Je rapporteert aan de teamleider en bent werkzaam in een 5 ploegendienst. Je bent onderdeel van een team van 15 personen.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Indien je voor deze functie wordt aangenomen begin je eerst op de werkvloer om onze productieprocessen goed te leren kennen. Dit doe je aan de hand van Takenlijsten. Indien deze afgerond zijn en je kunt door naar de Centrale Controle Kamer.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Naar verwachting zal het opleidingstraject in combinatie met het opdoen van werkervaring 1-2 jaar in beslag nemen, afhankelijk van jou kennis en ervaring.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Verantwoordelijkheden<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Als Centrale Controle Kamer (CCK) Operator binnen het GPB ben je verantwoordelijk voor het bedienen, controleren en regelen van utility installaties en productieprocessen ter plekke en vanuit de controlekamer.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Het bedienen van de apparatuur op een hygiënische en veilige manier in overeenstemming met alle procedures, GMP, HACCP en VGM-instructies en richtlijnen. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Continu verbeteren is een dagelijks onderdeel van je werk. In totaal zijn er meerdere werkplekken te onderscheiden, verdeeld over lab, veld en controlekamer. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Tijden je shift ben je verantwoordelijk voor het resultaat op het gebied van SHE, Kwaliteit, Kwantiteit en Budget (verliezen, energie) en de bijbehorende verantwoordingsrapportages (PCB) en actie (voorstellen). <\u002Fli>\n   <li>De planning van productie, reiniging en onderhoud en bijbehorende acties op afwijkingen daarin voor zijn cluster 24 uur vooruit. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Het aansturen van stoppen, veiligstellen, in gebruik nemen, starten, reinigen van processen en installaties binnen zijn cluster. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Het bijsturen van recepten en processen op basis van analyseresultaten. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Het ondersteunen van de veldoperator bij afwijkingen in het veld vanuit de controlekamer en het bijsturen van de gevolgen hiervan binnen de fabriek waar je op dat moment voor verantwoordelijk bent.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Veiligheid is je prioriteit, dit betekent dat je:\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Veilig gedrag te allen tijde (bij jezelf en bij anderen) wilt bevorderen; Je geeft zelf hierin het goede voorbeeld door gebruik te maken van de juiste PBM’s en bent gedisciplineerd in het naleven van de veiligheidsvoorschriften en VGM-normen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Je gedraagt op een dusdanige wijze dat de veiligheid bewustwording en preventie van ongevallen worden beschouwd bij de uitvoering van alle taken.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Wij bieden<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Onze bedrijfscultuur is informeel, open en biedt ruimte voor eigen initiatief.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Een werkomgeving waar groei en veiligheid hoog in het vaandel staan. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Zeer afwisselend werk in een toonaangevend en succesvol bedrijf. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je werkt in een 5 ploegendienst; 2 Ochtend, 2 Middag, 2 Nacht, 4 vrij. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Diverse mogelijkheden tot groei binnen de productieorganisatie. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden in overeenstemming met de functie.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>De mogelijkheid om op de site te sporten voor maar 15 euro per maand in een nieuwe sportschool.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Op basis van je ervaring bieden we je een basissalaris van 36K tot 52K per jaar (inclusief vakantiegeld en 13e maand) en extra voordelen, zoals 25 vakantiedagen, een bonus, de mogelijkheid om meer vakantiedagen te kopen met een 6% my choice budget en nog veel meer.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Deze functie werkt in 5 ploegen en daarom ontvang je 30% ploegentoeslag.\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Jij brengt<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Je hebt een VAPRO-B of gelijkwaardig technische diploma (bijvoorbeeld Operator B). ATO niveau 3 heeft de voorkeur. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke operator functie, een controlekamer functie is onderdeel van je ervaring. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ervaring met Lean en\u002Fof Voedselveiligheid is een pré. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>De positie vereist het vermogen om werkinstructies, procedures en veiligheidsvoorschriften gedisciplineerd op te volgen. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je bent een nieuwsgierige, praktisch ingestelde aanpakker, sterk in probleemanalyse en in staat in stressvolle situaties adequaat te handelen. Observeren, nadenken en daarna pas handelen is daarbij basishouding. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je bent in staat je collega’s aan te spreken op hun gedrag en DSM normen. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands (zowel mondeling als schriftelijk). Je bent in staat Engels te lezen en begrijpen. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je werkt graag samen in een team.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Procedure &amp; Contact <\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Interesse in deze functie? Solliciteer online middels het sturen van jouw CV en motivatiebrief. Mede door de nieuwe privacy wetgeving, accepteren we geen sollicitaties via email. Voor eventuele vragen kun je contact opnemen met, Ruslana Lohina \u002F Talent Acquisition Business Partner (ruslana.lohina@dsm.com).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Werken bij DSM betekent dat de kans om echt bij te dragen aan het verbeteren van het leven van mensen aan oplossingen te werken aan dagelijks uitdagingen. Met uitdagend werk, carrièremogelijkheden en een inspirerende omgeving krijgt u de kans uw persoonlijke ontwikkeling te verbeteren. DSM erkent dat het succes van de onderneming afhangt van de verdere ontwikkeling en de betrokkenheid van onze medewerkers en streeft naar een eerlijk en concurrerend beloningsbeleid en het herkennen van individuele en team competenties en prestaties.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Referentie checks en een assessment kunnen deel uitmaken van de DSM Sollicitatieproces. Je wordt geïnformeerd indien dit vereist is.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Acquisitie nav deze advertentie word niet op prijs gesteld.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Koninklijke DSM is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt en aan positieve discriminatie doet, en alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden beoordeeld zonder te kijken naar ras, kleur, religie, geslacht, nationaliteit, leeftijd, beschermde veteranenstatus, status als gekwalificeerde persoon met een beperking, of enige andere door de wet beschermde eigenschap.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Koninklijke DSM en de hieraan gelieerde ondernemingen genereren een netto jaaromzet van ca. €10 miljard met ongeveer 23.000 werknemers. Het bedrijf is beursgenoteerd op Euronext. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Dairy Alternative and Nutrition Protein Specialist \u002F NL Delft \u002F 63911 – On Site \u002F Hybrid<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Business Group<\u002Fb>: DSM Food &amp; Beverage\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>Business Unit<\u002Fb>: Proteins of the Future (POFU)\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>Reports to<\u002Fb>: Innovation and Technology Director POFU\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>Direct reports<\u002Fb>: None\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>Indirect reports<\u002Fb>: None\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What you’ll do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The Business Unit POFU (Proteins of the Future), part of the Business Group Food &amp; Beverage, is developing proteins of the future that help the global food industry meet the fast-changing needs of consumers.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The Dairy Alternative and Nutrition Protein Specialist focuses on pre-launch activities (product &amp; application development) and supports the post launch activities (market application).\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The function can have a more internal (knowledge exchange, coordination) as well as a more external role (contact with customers, external institutions), dependent upon the agreed focus. The relationship with commercial functions is focused on determining customer trends and supporting commercial functions with tools and training.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The job mainly consists of several roles, which can occur in different combinations:\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Product Development, Application Development, Product Positioning, and Product and Application Specialism. For each of the 4 roles, the purpose is as stated below.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Job Content:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Product development –<\u002Fb> to develop new products in line with the requirements and specifications defined by business (line) management:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Initiate ideas for new products and\u002For technologies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Set specification targets for new product and\u002For technology development.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Test prototypes of new products as such and in application, and give feedback to R&amp;D.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop new products and\u002For technologies in line with business plans\u002Frequests.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Define product specifications.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Determine positioning of new products and develop the technical value proposition (see also product positioning).<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Application development – <\u002Fb>To develop (new) applications, both for existing and new products, in line with <li>Test shelf life of DSM products in applications<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop and maintain application know-how.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Product substitutes to support the sales process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Know the product portfolio of main competitors to assess customer needs and possibilities for DSM products.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Know how products perform in different applications, and how they behave\u002Freact\u002Finfluence the production process and shelf life of end applications.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support commercial functions to holiday days with a 6% my choice budget and much more.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Identifies market needs and technological trends.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provide appropriate technical training to technical specialists, sales team, distributors, and R&amp;D for the development of new materials and\u002For processes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Is the owner of the product formulas.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports sourcing plan by definition of specs and validation of materials to purchase.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Is involved in industrial trials and in the subsequent interpretation of results in order to achieve the best knowledge base for our products.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides technical support to customers (on request) with existing or new products (internal trials, analyses, sampling etc.). Converts R&amp;D reports into customer reports and advice.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Organizes and stores all relevant documentation around its area in order to provide to the Commecial Specialist the relevant information to prepare sales and communication tools for products (brochures, presentations, press releases etc.).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides to the Commercial Specialist the technical content in standard product documentation, and in any other technical documentation supporting Marketing &amp; Sales.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares the technical content of documents and presentation given at meetings and seminars about defined products and\u002For applications.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports process customer technical complaints.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Secures expert level knowledge and know-how in specific products and applications.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Authorities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Can contact and visit customers, after consultation and alignment with responsible sales managers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Can have access to sales and information on customers and products.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Can have access to relevant product cost prices and cost breakdowns<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Can initiate contact and establish a network with institutes, in consultation with the Innovation and Technology Director.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Can call upon institutes and\u002For external partners to perform analytical or application work, in consultation with the Innovation and Technology Director.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>High scientific level together with expert knowledge of nutrition science.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Academic Level, preferably a <b>food technologist<\u002Fb>, with work done in the field of <b>protein processing<\u002Fb> in <b>food manufacturing<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Expert level knowledge and experience with dairy alternative manufacturing, (plant) protein processing, food technology, nutrition science.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working in a complex matrix organization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Dealing with people in different setting and of different background.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Research &amp; <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The \n   <i>Center of Biotechnology Innovation<\u002Fi> (CBI), located within the Rosalind Franklin Biotechnology Center (RFBC), is the primary location for Synthetic Biology Research and BioProcess Development. The Center, uniquely located within the Science and Innovation (S&amp;I) Organization, spans activities across the entire Innovation pipeline from inception to research and development and later commercial production. The Center has world class competences in genetics, molecular biology, metabolic engineering, and bioprocess development. Further, as part of the \n   <i>Biosciences and Process Innovation <\u002Fi>(BPI) sub-group, it is responsible for delivering new bioproducts and sustainable bioprocesses, to all of the Nutrition, Health and Wellness businesses.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Locally, from the RFBC location in Delft, and together with the Centers for Digital, Analytical and Food Innovation, we conduct high-throughput screening, strain engineering, bioinformatics and modeling, industrial bioprocessing, biochemistry, application, and analytics research and development to create and improve a diverse set of bioproducts such as sweeteners, carotenoids, nutritional lipids, proteins, vitamins and enzymes. Globally we are well connected to our Global Research and Development locations in China, France, Denmark, Switzerland, Germany, Austria and the United States, along with a number of external research institutes and universities, in order to develop and deliver novel innovations to the customers we serve.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Today, the \n   <i>Sustainable Nutrients and Processes<\u002Fi> team, who develop and implement new products and bioprocesses, in line with our Innovation and Net Zero sustainability goals, has an opening for a:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Sr. Bioprocess Development Engineer<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   As a (Sr.) Bioprocess Development Engineer you will represent the CBI Research &amp; Development teams, when transfering technology from R&amp;D to Piloting and Manufacturing while working in innovative, multi-disciplinary R&amp;D project teams.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Developing, implementing, and improving bioprocesses, by evaluating at lab, pilot, and production scale, utilizing both internal and external (tollers\u002FCMO) facilities;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provide leadership, guidance and support to other scientists, specialists, engineers, and technicians; <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Create work plans, supervise the scientific work &amp; report results;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working on innovative technological solutions, and monitor relevant external developments.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring <\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>The chance to shape DSM and its impact for years to come;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>International team that is not afraid to think outside of the box;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A supportive environment where you’re empowered to grow and share your ideas;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A good Collective Labor Agreement and competitive salary;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Besides 25 paid holidays plus budget to buy additionally up to 13 extra holidays;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Based on your experience we will offer you a base salary of € 70,000 to € 100,000 per year (including holiday allowance and 13th month) and extra benefits, such as 25 holiday days, a bonus, the option to buy more holiday days with a 6% my choice budget and much more.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>MSc or PhD degree in the field of Bioprocessing, (Bio)chemical engineering and Food Technology (having downstream processing &amp; formulation expertise is an advantage);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive (&gt;10 yrs.) experience in an industrial relevant environment. Having experience in Piloting, Demonstration or Commercial-scale bioprocessing is an advantage;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Willingness to work in an R&amp;D organization and bring your manufacturing expertise into the development of new technology and processes;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge of bioprocess data processing and process modeling, techno-economic assessments, and life cycle analysis;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to combine problem analysis with practical judgment and creativity with high standard for quality;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Team player attitude, ability to thrive in an ambiguous environment and communicate effectively with fellow professionals, at various levels within and outside the organization;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collaborative, entrepreneurial, proactive, responsible, result-orientated, and flexible attitude;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good communication skills (written and verbal) in English.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided. For additional questions you can contact, Ruslana Lohina (ruslana.lohina@dsm.com).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   A reference check procedures and\u002For and assessment can be part of the recruitment process. You will be informed when these procedures are required.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and help solving the challenges of today’s world. Challenging jobs, career opportunities and an inspiring environment allow you to enhance your personal development. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team competencies and performance.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The BGFC team is responsible for the actual balance sheet and P&amp;L reporting of the HNB cluster and the BGs (ANH, HNC, F&amp;B, Operations and Innovation). They provide accurate insights in actual reporting and steer the closing and reporting processes based on corporate and business requirements. It is a part of Financial Control within the Finance Regions, which is, next to the global FP&amp;A team, one of the main stakeholders. Within the Finance Regions they collaborate with the Regional Financial Control Leads, Legal Entity Controllers and Operations Control Support.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The BGGFC team is the gatekeeper of IFRS compliancy and Consolidation tools (CFIN and Group Reporting) and plays an important role in structure changes, such as acquisitions, disposals, and mergers (Firmenich integration).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <i>Financial &amp; Management Reporting:<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Ensures the reporting of actuals is correct and complete by performing relevant analyses in close cooperation with the FP&amp;A team and Innovation\u002FOperations controlling functions<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Steers the financial closing process (consolidation and reporting) across Regions and FSS<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures integrity of financial Statements and management reports in accordance with DSM Accounting Rules \u002F Management reporting standards, international and local statutory accounting standards<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Single Point of Contact for the BGs when it relates to accurate and complete actual reporting<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <i>Analysis, Budgeting and Forecasting:<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>BGFC drives the business process and the reporting per BG. BGFC coordinates the budgeting activities at the Finance Regions (according to the FP&amp;A budget instructions) and pro-actively supports the BG<\u002Fli> \n   <li>BGFC is involved in ensuring that budget and rolling forecasts are periodically loaded correctly and completely into the systems<\u002Fli> \n   <li>BGFC acts as finance business partner to supporting functions in non-BG cluster (Innovation and Operations) where he\u002Fshe coordinates, advises and challenges on actuals, budget and rolling forecasts<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <i>Internal Control and Auditing:<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Ensures compliance with DAR (DSM accounting rules) across the legal entities of the cluster<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinating role for external audits and follow up audit findings<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Sign-off the BG closing checklist (closing cockpit), internal control framework and balance sheet management<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <i>Best Practices sharing:<\u002Fi>\n   <br> As the BGFC team will be working according to a new team set up, using new consolidation tools (CFIN and Group Reporting), you’ll be part of the creation of this BGFC team – new style by:\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Building synergies within the team<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understanding the financial business needs<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Sharing best practices on for instance reporting and analytical solutions, by making use of the newest tooling<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   BG Control will be involved in projects, both in financial control as in non-financial control. In non-financial control projects he\u002Fshe acts as a representative of the financial control community to safeguard the input from financial control.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A dynamic work environment with many challenges that give you the possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions. You are giving the freedom to be creative and proactive;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>An inclusive and multicultural team with respect for everyone;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Flexibility at work – working in the office (Heerlen) in combination with working remotely;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A good Collective Labor Agreement and competitive salary;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>We offer you the possibility to grow and develop yourself professionally and personally.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Based on your experience we will offer you a base salary of € 70,000 to € 100,000 per year (including holiday allowance and 13th month) and extra benefits, such as 25 holiday days, a bonus, the option to buy more holiday days with a 6% my choice budget and much more.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>(post) Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Accounting\u002FFinancial Controlling, and\u002For licensed certified public accountant;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>At least 5 years of experience within several finance positions;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge and experience in a Shared Service environment;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Affinity with and a passion for understanding the business behind the numbers;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Analytical skills and ability to translate financial information into relevant management information;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good presentation and communication skills;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>In-depth understanding of Finance and Accounting processes and ERP systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided. For additional questions you can contact, Ruslana Lohina (ruslana.lohina@dsm.com).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   A pre-employment screening, reference check procedures and\u002For and assessment can be part of the recruitment process. You will be informed when these procedures are required.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and help solving the challenges of today’s world. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team competencies and performance.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. <div>\n  <div>\n   DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   More information can be found at www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM’s Science and Innovation laboratories in Delft and Wageningen are part of the DSM global state-of-the-art Science and Innovation organization. In Delft and Wageningen, about 350 biotech talents from over 27 countries work for DSM Science and Innovation, building up extensive expertise and developing leading technology in Health, Nutrition &amp; Bioscience.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The QESH Advisor, as member of the QESH team, informs, advises, coaches, challenges and supports the NL based Science and Innovation laboratories on Safety, Health, Quality and Environment (QESH), in order to secure a healthy and incident-free working environment, today and tomorrow.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key-responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Build, maintain, manage and implement the QESH Management system.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Implement new and existing Q and SHE legislations, requirements and standards, including the execution of gap assessments and implementation of fit-for-purpose policies, procedures and best practices. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Execute and guide internal and external audits, Gemba and supervision rounds in labs and offices.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Give\u002Fparticipate in QESH training and coaching of (new) employees in their daily activities, concerning practical SHE and Quality measures to be used in their experimental setup, as well as workplace ergonomics checks, ergonomics trainings and advice in labs and offices.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Execute, lead or chair SHE Risk assessments in labs and offices, such as Job Safety Assessments, Machine Safety Assessment (“verdiepende machine-RI&amp;E”), TIER-2 exposure at the workplace assessments. Contribute to the execution of the ‘Risk Inventory- and Evaluation’ (RI&amp;E).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Incident investigations: lead &amp; report Root Cause Analysis (RCAs), determine the facts related to an incident based on employee participation, execution of site inspections and collection of other evidence.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Be a member of the Management of Change (MoC) team: provide input on SHE and Quality for (the purchase of) lab and office equipment, as well as for processes, activities and projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>You get the opportunity to be at the front of Biotechnology Innovations, for which Quality, Environment, Health and Safety are of key importance<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You get the opportunity to be of great added value to the workplace of the science community within DSM. <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>A dynamic work environment with many challenges that give you the possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions. You are giving the freedom to be creative and proactive. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>An inclusive and multicultural team with respect for everyone. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>We offer you the possibility to grow and develop yourself professionally and personally. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>A good Collective Labor Agreement and competitive salary.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Besides 25 paid holidays plus budget to buy additionally up to 13 extra holidays. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>A membership for only 15 Euros per month at a newly equipped gym on site.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Degree in Safety Engineering (HVK, MVK).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years experience in different industries, in particular in relation to the execution of Job Safety Assessments, Machine Safety Assessments, TIER-2 exposure assessments, RI&amp;E’s, workplace ergonomics, incident investigations and audits.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with working in multidisciplinary teams.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Fluency in English and Dutch (written and spoken).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Being skilled in application of dedicated software and digital tools is a prerequisite.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Flexible, result oriented mindset, can-do mentality.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>The Procedure &amp; Contact <\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV &amp; motivation letter in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided. For additional questions you can contact, Clémentine Rolaff-van de Panne \u002F Recruitment Business Partner (Clementine.panne-van-de@dsm.com).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Reference check procedures and an assessment can be part of the DSM Recruitment &amp; Selection Process. You will be informed when these procedures are required.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. Keep up-to date with scientific literature;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Build up efficient communication within RD and Business stakeholders of DSM located mostly in Wageningen and Delft (both in the Netherlands).<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   We offer a challenging job at our world-leading R&amp;D organization, fully supporting DSM’s purpose-led, performance driven strategy, high employee engagement figures and opportunity for working with the top of external and internal experts. You will work in a company with an international reputation as sustainability leader. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team performance.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The freedom to be creative and proactive;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A hybrid workplace that offers flexibility to employees across the business;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>We offer you the possibility to grow and develop yourself professionally and personally;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A team of diverse employees who are not afraid to think outside of the box;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A truly global and collaborative team that cares about the experience of our employees.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Based on your experience we will offer you a base salary of €70K to €90K per year (including holiday allowance and 13th month) and extra benefits, such as 25 holiday days, a bonus, the option to buy more holiday days with a 6,11% MyChoice budget and much more.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>The Ideal<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>You have PhD knowledge level in Chemical, Biochemical or Food process Engineer or similar by training;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You have more than 10 years of experience in the area of lactic acid bacteria, interaction with bacteriophages and (preferably) microbial bio-protection, preferably in an industrial setting;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You have experience in portfolio management in Research and Development;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You have strong communicating skills and are resilient and flexible;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>We are looking for people with plenty of initiative, who like to learn and work in multidisciplinary teams in an innovative environment;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You are an active networker and good communicator, fluent in English;<\u002Fli> \n are a strategic thinker with a helicopter view.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About DSM Food &amp; Beverage R&amp;D Culture House<\u002Fb>\n   <br> DSM has been active in the market for starter cultures for decades and operates globally. To develop new products and support operations with current products, DSM employs an R&amp;D team “Culture House”, in the Netherlands. The R&amp;D team of “Culture House” is responsible for developing new bacterial ingredients for cheese and fresh fermented market segments and collaborates closely with internal and external customers, (global) application development teams, and (global) operations teams.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM Food &amp; Beverage (F&amp;B) is the prime partner for food producers that want to bring their product to the next level. At F&amp;B, leverage our knowledge in taste, texture and health to bring complete solutions that can feed the world in a sustainable way.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The Yeast Production Plant (YPP) in Delft is one of the oldest and largest production facilities for yeast extracts in the world. It produces a portfolio of ingredients that are used to modulate taste, based on proprietary yeast strains. The plant is fully loaded (100% occupation; 7 days a week, 24 hours\u002Fday) and demand\u002Fsupply needs to be closely balanced. To stay a sustainable profitable business continuous improvements are needed. \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   At the YPP, the Improve Plant department is responsible for the selection, development, and implementation of all value-adding projects. They work in close alignment with various stakeholders. Currently, major projects are getting off the ground with the aim to upgrade key parts of the plant and improve the sustainability footprint of the site.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The Improve Plant team has an opening for a\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Process Technologist<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   As a Process Technologist, you will be bringing both incremental and radical improvements from concept to production.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Identify, rank and lead improvement opportunities (e.g., capacity extension, cost reduction, energy reduction), quality and yield improvements;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support the introduction and transfer of new products or processes (developed by R&amp;D) to a manufacturing environment;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bridge between many departments (manufacturing, supply chain, QA, SHE, R&amp;D, project engineering, plant management team and the business) Able to effectively communicate at all levels;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>As a technologist for the extraction facility, you will focus on the operations in these sections as your core area of expertise, as well as acting as a linking pin between up- and downstream process, quality, and business.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The opportunity to shape the yeast production plant for the future, in line with ambitious targets of DSM Food &amp; Beverage;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supportive team that is not afraid to think outside the box;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Highly diverse environment where you interact on various levels;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A good Collective Labour Agreement and competitive salary;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>25 paid holidays plus budget to buy additionally up to 13 extra holidays;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Based on your experience we will offer you a base salary of € 53,000 to € 75,000 per year (including holiday allowance and 13th month) and extra benefits, such as 25 holiday days, a bonus, the option to buy more holiday days with a 6% my choice budget and much more.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>MSc degree in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Food Technology or Biotechnology;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in batch, autolysis, centrifugation and evaporation processes;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge of bioprocess data processing. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM Biotechnology Center (DBC) is the biotech Research and Development engine for royal DSM, a global science-based company active in health, nutrition, and materials. DBC is responsible for the realization of biotech innovations and the developments of novel bio-products and sustainable bioprocesses.\n   <br> DBC is located on the DSM site in Delft, along with the global head quarter of DSM Food Specialties. This site is also part of one of the largest biotechnology hubs in Europe (Biotech Campus Delft), which features a bio-processing pilot plant and many collaborative projects with the Technical University of Delft.\n   <br> About 300 biotech talents from over 27 countries work for DBC, with strong competences in high-throughput screening, strain development, bioinformatics and modeling, industrial bioprocessing, application, microbiology and advanced analytics. DBC is well connected with DSM R&amp;D hubs around the world, and with globally leading research institutes and universities.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   As a Technician Microbiology, you will be a member of the DBC Strain Conservation Unit (SCU), the unit within DBC Operations which is responsible for the conservation, storage and supply of production strains in relation to the DSM production sites, as well as for research strains in relation to R&amp;D. Together with the other team members, you will apply the appropriate microbiological standards, in order to guarantee a storage and supply of strains at the highest quality level.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   This is an excellent opportunity to develop your career and advance your skills for the next 3-5 years!\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div>\n   <b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Generation of master- and working cell banks (MCB, WCB) of DSM production strains, covering a diverse range of microbial species (bacteria, yeasts, fungi), including execution and reporting of quality control tests;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Shipment of cell bank material to DSM production sites in a variety of countries;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Intake, conservation and storage of strains from DSM R&amp;D, as well as from external culture collections, into the DSM culture collection;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supply of strains from the collection to R&amp;D projects, to DBC as well as to other biotech R&amp;D units in DSM;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Record all relevant data in the DSM Strain Management System. Use the system to provide strain information on request.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A dynamic work environment with many challenges that give you the possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions. You are giving the freedom to be creative and proactive;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>An inclusive and multicultural team with respect for everyone;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A good Collective Labor Agreement and competitive salary;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>We offer you the possibility to grow and develop yourself professionally and personally.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>MLO degree with extensive experience in microbiology or Bachelor’s degree with a specialization in Microbiology;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Fluency in the Dutch is a must and well-versed in English;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>At least two years of experience in a microbiological laboratory environment, preferably working experience with a diverse range of microbial species (bacteria, yeasts and fungi) and specific quality requirements (Kosher, Halal);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Familiarity with structured working according to GLP is a requirement, knowledge of molecular biological techniques is an advantage;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Practical experience with laboratory and office software;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A combination of thorough problem analysis with practical judgment to provide solutions within the constraints posed by the task at hand;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proactive, flexible, result oriented mindset, fast learner, can-do mentality.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided. <div>\n  <div>\n   DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Koninklijke DSM is een wereldwijd, ‘purpose-led’ bedrijf dat vanuit wetenschappelijke basis actief is op het gebied van gezondheid, voeding en duurzaam leven. DSM streeft ernaar om de kwaliteit van leven voor iedereen te verbeteren. Met zijn producten en oplossingen gaat DSM enkele van ’s werelds grootste uitdagingen aan en creëert tegelijk economische, milieutechnische en maatschappelijke waarde voor al zijn belanghebbenden – klanten, medewerkers, aandeelhouders en de samenleving in haar geheel. DSM levert innovatieve oplossingen voor voeding, diervoeding, persoonlijke verzorging en aroma’s, medische apparatuur, groene producten en toepassingen, en nieuwe mobiliteit en connectiviteit. DSM en de hieraan gelieerde ondernemingen genereren met ongeveer 23.000 werknemers een netto jaaromzet van ca. €10 miljard. Het bedrijf werd in 1902 opgericht en is beursgenoteerd op Euronext Amsterdam. Meer informatie vindt u op www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM Food &amp; Beverage is werelds grootste aanbieder van voedsel enzymen, culturen, smaak en gezondheid ingrediënten. Onze productie site in Leeuwarden bestaat uit 2 fabrieken. Onze fabriek voor cultures (Apolloplant) is uniek en technisch zeer hoogwaardig. Met de modernste apparatuur kweken wij hier culturen (bacteriën) die worden gebruikt om de smaak en textuur te geven aan de lekkerste zuivelproducten van onze klanten. De culturen worden per batch gekweekt diepgevroren, gemengd en verpakt. In onze andere fabriek (Pallasplant) produceren we de meer traditionele zuivel ingrediënten, zoals stremsel, coating en media.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Als Maintenance Technician ben je verantwoordelijk voor het oplossen van storingen en het (preventief) onderhoud van productiemiddelen en utiliteiten. Je initieert en implementeert verbetervoorstellen en modificaties, bent betrokken bij de ontwikkeling en uitvoering van diverse technische projecten en fungeert als contactpersoon voor externe partijen.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Je werkt in dagdienst, maar gemiddeld 1 in de 4 weken ben je geconsigneerd. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Maintenance &amp; Engineering.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Verantwoordelijkheden<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Storingen lokaliseren en mogelijke oplossingen aandragen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Praktische oplossingen voor technische problemen voorstellen. Waar nodig root cause analyses uitvoeren.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Schade en defecten aan apparatuur repareren volgens technische instructies en bespreek QESH-voorzorgsmaatregelen met de maintenance engineering. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Indien nodig, aanvullende technische informatie zoals tekeningen en handleidingen raadplegen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Het uitvoeren van geplande preventieve en voorspelde onderhoudstaken binnen de planning. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Testen van apparatuur voordat het weer in gebruik wordt genomen. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Houd de juiste administratie bij van uitgevoerde bestellingen, technische gegevens, daadwerkelijke ervaring en benodigde middelen <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Geef een mening over de technische staat van geïnspecteerde apparatuur en stel verbeteringen voor.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Je werkt volgens onze (QESH) Quality, Health, Environment en Safety richtlijnen en instructies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Je werkt in (mogelijk verschoven) dagdienst en draait consignatie.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Wij Bieden<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>In deze functie kom je te werken op een site die volop in ontwikkeling zit en een strategie heeft gericht op groei van het Globale Culture netwerk.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onze bedrijfscultuur is informeel, open en biedt ruimte voor eigen initiatief.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Een werkomgeving waar groei en veiligheid hoog in het vaandel staan. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Zeer afwisselend werk in een toonaangevend en succesvol bedrijf. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Een hybride flexibele werkplek met een maintenance organisatie die zich voorbereid om in verschoven diensten een 24\u002F5 productie proces te ondersteunen. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Diverse mogelijkheden tot groei binnen de DSM organisatie. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden in overeenstemming met de functie.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Jij brengt<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Een afgeronde opleiding in de richting van Werktuigbouwkunde of Electrotechniek met minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring binnen Productie in de voedingsindustrie of 10 jaar werkervaring indien niet in de voedingsindustrie. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je hebt kennis van en ervaring met Mechatronica. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je hebt een sterke drive om performance continue te verbeteren en hebt veilig werken hoog in het vaandel staan. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je bent een aanpakker, bent in staat dingen te overzien en blijft rustig in stressvolle situaties. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je hebt ervaring met SAP Maintenance, archief systemen, contractor management en spare parts optimalisatie. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je spreek vloeiende Nederlands en kan goed Engels lezen en schrijven. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Je bent bereid om consignatie te draaien.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Procedure &amp; Contact<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interesse in deze functie? Solliciteer online middels het sturen van jouw CV en motivatiebrief. Mede door de nieuwe privacy wetgeving, accepteren we geen sollicitaties via email. Voor eventuele vragen kun je contact opnemen met, Clémentine Rolaff-van de Panne \u002F Recruitment Business Partner (Clementine.panne-van-de@dsm.com).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Werken bij DSM betekent een kans om echt bij te dragen aan het verbeteren van het leven van mensen. Met uitdagend werk, carrièremogelijkheden en een inspirerende omgeving krijgt u de mogelijkheid uw persoonlijke ontwikkeling te verbeteren. DSM erkent dat het succes van de onderneming afhangt van de verdere ontwikkeling en de betrokkenheid van zijn medewerkers en streeft naar een eerlijk en concurrerend beloningsbeleid, en het herkennen van individuele- en team competenties en prestaties.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Referentie checks en een assessment kunnen deel uitmaken van de DSM Sollicitatieproces. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Job description:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   We are looking for an EP Patent Attorney specialized in chemical process technology and polymer chemistry to support the Intellectual Property (IP) department of DSM Engineering Materials (DEM). DEM is a world leader in high-performance and increasingly sustainable thermoplastics. The materials enable lighter, stronger and more durable products – which in turn makes people’s lives safer, more convenient and healthier – and all while helping to tackle carbon emissions. Within DEM, a small team of IP professionals provides global IP services. The team located in Geleen works closely together and is looking for an enthusiastic European Patent attorney.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   In this position, you will assist in securing, protecting and actively building the IP position of DEM. As our new colleague you will deal with a broad variation of IP topics including creation of IP rights, ensuring freedom-to-operate, support in negotiations around IP in business deals and in strategic decisions around innovation and the direction hereof, mapping out competition and business opportunities and acting as a true business partner to the DEM organisation.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Draft, file and prosecute patent applications worldwide.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Represent the organisation in oral proceedings before the EPO (examination and post-grant proceedings).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage a global patent portfolio and report out to different functions in the organisation on different IP aspects.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Draft various opinions on patentability and risks assessments, including opinions for (in)validity and freedom to operate. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Create and enhance IP awareness within the organisation through training and defining and implementing IP guidelines and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Define and support in enforcing the IP Strategy.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Advise on research, cooperation, licensing and non-disclosure agreements and support in negotiations with third parties.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitor and report on patent activities of competitors and customers. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Be a business partner and participate in bridging IP with the rest of DEM organisation.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>You have a University degree in Chemistry or Chemical process engineering field, or strongly related fields.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You are a qualified European Patent attorney, with EQE post-qualification patent attorney experience in private practice or industry (preferred) in the chemical sector. Holding both EQE and national patent attorney qualifications may be an advantage. Almost EQE qualified candidates will also be considered.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You have excellent communication and language skills in English (written and spoken). Any other language, e.g., Dutch\u002FGerman may be an advantage.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You have a customer-oriented approach with good technical, analytical and organizational skills. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global science-based company active in health, nutrition and materials. DSM delivers innovative solutions that nourish, protect and improve performance in global markets such as food and dietary supplements, personal care, feed, medical devices, automotive, paints, electrical and electronics, life protection, alternative energy and bio-based materials.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Expert Chromatography<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   <b>Drive improvements. Develop concepts.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What you’ll do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   At this role you will work in the Research and Technology department on solving both short- and long-term problems in the field of chromatography (both liquid and gas) of engineering polymers. You will tackle customer questions with a scientific approach utilizing your understanding of polymer characterization. As an expert, you will identify the problems brought to you by the Business and you will cooperate with other experts to find solutions through experimental work. Moreover, your analysis will guide the development of products and applications for DSM Engineering Materials. You will be stimulated and coached to develop yourself in both the business and scientific projects, as well as on your personal skills like entrepreneurship, communication, and leadership. At this position you will report to R&amp;T Manager Analytics. We offer a hybrid workplace with the office located in \n   <b>Geleen<\u002Fb>.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Working on short- and long-term projects to fulfill urgent customer needs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Developing new competences in characterization of polymers via technologies like liquid chromatography with mass spectrometry and gas chromatography.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working on new technological developments in chromatography and quantification of polymers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Timely identifying and resolving instrumental issues to ensure operational excellence.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Making expertise know-how available, ensuring that the respective competence delivers a high-end result to the projects.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participating in the projects by setting up and executing the required experiments in a safe, reliable, and accurate way. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Reporting and presenting the acquired knowledge of the different experiments to the project team.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Contributing to projects by participating in project teams as a team member, both by performing experiments but also by guiding the process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Indicating solutions to keep developments and production ongoing within the defined constraints (money, time) and in compliance with all applicable regulations and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Planning and organizing execution of research activities in the field of responsibility, aligned with the team, Senior Experts and Resource Manager.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Engineering Materials (DEM) produces and sells a broad assortment of engineering plastics in the market segments Automotive, Electrical &amp; Electronics, Specialty Industries, Extrusion\u002FPackaging and Distribution. With a global turnover of more than €1M and over 1700 employees, DEM is one of the prominent suppliers of Engineering Plastics worldwide. DEM material solutions can be found in many products with the Electronics, Automotive or General Industries. Sales offices and representatives are located at almost all major countries in Europe, Asia Pacific, and the USA.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The markets in which DEM operates are very dynamic with customers who use complex value chains and focus more and more on global approach. Professionals of DE intercept on technology, application, and total cost of semi and\u002For product. For more information, please visit www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A team of diverse employees who are not afraid to think outside of the box.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A truly global and collaborative team that cares about the experience of our customers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The encouragement you need to develop and achieve the goals you set.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A caring and supportive environment where you’re empowered to grow and share your ideas.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Challenging and rewarding job in a team of highly professional peers within an innovative global company with lots of opportunities for personal development.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Master’s degree or higher with a background in analytical chemistry, particularly in chromatography of polymers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in analytical methods development.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>At least two years’ experience in an industrial R&amp;D setting.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work in multi-functional teams.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good planning skills and capabilities in Project Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good social and communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Practical, enthusiastic, proactive, and flexible attitude.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Our recruitment processes<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   As a Business Process Analyst, you will be the employed at DSM Pension Services (DPS). DPS executes pension plans and executes asset management of two main pension clients in the Netherlands being Stichting Pensioenfonds SABIC (SPF) and Stichting Pensioenfonds DSM Nederland (PDN).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The environment within which DPS functions, changes rapidly and can be characterized as an innovative and demanding business. You will have to opportunity to be involved in the design of the procedures and processes to implement the new pension law.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The Business Process Analyst secures the quality, stability and continuity of the information management of the pension’s organization within DPS and makes sure the processes of pensions are optimized, efficient and effective and are being adhered to and guarantees that the processes are in full compliance with laws and regulations and the best practices as given by the regulatory supervisors. The next key tasks are handled by the Business Process Analyst:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Analyzing, describing, and improving the business processes of the Pensions and Communications Department. Recording all business processes and procedures of the pensions department in the IT application (CERRIX);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Testing the processes and procedures against legislation and regulations, corporate requirements, agreed upon control frameworks (e.g. COSO);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Acting as Key User by supporting the pensions department in the use of the pension system, centralizing system related questions, deriving solutions for issues in the pension system and ensuring a solid solution in close cooperation with the Functional Application Managers;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Acting as knowledge expert in the field of process design and workflow management;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Contributing to a complete, correct, and timely pension administration. Compile, maintain and periodically reports to employees and management. Investigating and improving the so-called data integrity of the pension administration based on data analyses;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supporting the Manager Pensions and Communications in the field of services and jointly responsible for safeguarding the quality of the pension products;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinating projects and participating in projects in a supportive hands-on manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>You get the opportunity to be of great added value to our business, customers, employees and overall DSM;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You get the possibility to be the go to person for master data quality within DPS;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A dynamic work environment with many challenges that give you the possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions. You are giving the freedom to be creative and proactive.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Academic Degree Business analysis, Business administration, Business economics;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent project management skills, including effective leadership qualities in a matrix organization;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Two to five years of experience in a business process expertise role and proven knowledge of internal control.
