Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   For DSM Biomedical we are looking for a Senior Quality Engineer who is accustomed to working closely with customers and various functions within the company. And who has experience with process analysis, complaint handling, corrective action management, risk analysis and root cause analysis? If this sounds like you, let’s connect!\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Senior Quality Engineer<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>Geleen<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What You’ll do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   As the Senior Quality Engineer you support the Business Unit regarding engineering activities for targeted product lines; leading qualifications, designing, leading, and reporting validations, data analysis, statistical process control (SPC), CAPA, KPI’s, Review, and Trending. Responsible for product-related root cause analysis, process mapping and impact assessments for change control.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key-responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Expected to serve as primary contact with business unit customers of all sizes within platform expertise; including communicating data, reports, conclusions and changes;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop, document, and implement QA Procedures;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Analyze non-conforming materials and returned goods and recommend disposition and corrective actions;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Create suitable data analysis tables and report findings based on statistical evidence and trending;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provide analytical investigations and develop root cause for non-conformances and deviations;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Design and specify gauging and test equipment for quality assurance functions;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Design own experimental work, analyze data and generate summary reports;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interface with vendors and customers as required;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Input to design, execution and reporting of validations including Operational Qualifications, Process Qualifications, Measurement System Analysis and Test Method Validations;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Review documentation and reports for soundness of technical judgement, accuracy and conclusions;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assist in the performance of qualification and validation studies;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Create and\u002For process XCN’s, ECN’s, process routers, drawings and other written documentation in accordance with GMP requirements to support product development and manufacturing;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assist with product development and in the transition of development products and projects;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Review new product designs (internal and external) and make recommendations for quality requirements;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Plan, write and implement DOE’s and test protocols required to evaluate new and existing products;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitor processing, assembly, secondary operations and packaging operations for the purpose of improving efficiency\u002F process improvement and troubleshooting;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluate, identify and implement QA improvements to existing processes or products;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assist in capital budget creation and oversee implementation of capital projects;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Work closely with internal teams to coordinate, plan, and execute project requirements. Under guidance, lead multidisciplinary teams;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Adhere to Quality System procedures, ISO13485, 21CFR part 820 and current regulatory standards;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Release product batches and create certifications;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supervise engineers, technicians, interns.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A safe and inclusive workplace;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A possibility to join a global and cross functional team;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A learning surrounding in which you can develop yourself and your team to the next level;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A good Collective Labor Agreement and competitive salary;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Besides 25 paid holidays, a possibility to buy additionally up to 13 extra holidays once full time employed.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>BS Degree in Quality, Science, or Polymer Engineering or equivalent undergraduate experience;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>ASQE Certification a plus. 8;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>8-12 years Quality Engineering within a QA\u002FQC department at a FDA-Regulated, Medical Device, Pharmaceutical, Biotech, or other regulated industry;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good written and oral communications skills;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to lead and\u002For function as part of a team;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Computer literacy (ie – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, WindChill);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficient use of statistical techniques and software (i.e – Minitab);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understanding of GMP and standards;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge of medically useful biomaterials (degradable and non-degradable);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge of physical and chemical processing techniques. (ie- melt processing, compression molding, foaming, lyophilization, aseptic processing, cross-linking, sterilization);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working knowledge of analytical and mechanical test equipment;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supplier evaluation experience;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Internal and external auditing experience;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Managerial experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About us<\u002Fb>\n   <br> DSM Biomedical is the world’s unrivaled biomaterials expert and committed partner in driving sustainable innovation in healthcare. For more than 30 years, the company has been at the forefront of biomaterial science and process innovation, and the leading resource for global medical device and pharmaceutical companies. As a strategic partner with an approach driven not only by market dynamics but by the unique needs of every customer, DSM Biomedical brings an unparalleled breadth of product portfolios, proprietary manufacturing and processing capabilities, world-class IP, and extensive regulatory experience and expertise. Furthermore, DSM Biomedical’s products and services are recognized for their unmatched quality, consistency, and performance in multiple markets across the globe, supporting their company-wide vision of solving the world’s healthcare needs through sustainable science.\n   <br> To learn more, visit DSMBiomedical.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV &amp; motivation letter in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   For further information you can contact, Martin Zwart, Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner (martin.zwart@dsm.com).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   A Pre-Employment Screening, reference check procedures and assessment can be part of the recruitment process. Do you enjoy empowering and enabling people to be the best that they can be now and in the future?\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Then this may be the opportunity for you!\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Our Quality department is looking for a Global Supplier Quality Manager.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM Food &amp; Beverage is a leading global supplier of food enzymes, cultures, taste and health ingredients and other specialties. We do this for many of the leading global and local dairy, baking, beverage and savory food brands. Our advanced ingredients help our customers to differentiate their products with great taste, texture and appearance and optimize their production processes. We also embraced the Food System Commitments to achieve accessible, affordable, healthy nutrition and healthy livelihoods within our planet’s boundaries. DSM Food &amp; Beverages expects to grow through mergers and acquisitions and as a business continuously develop. This means an exciting and challenging place to be, especially for a Global Supplier Quality Manager.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   You will be responsible for the alignment in the way of working with our suppliers, whilst shaping your organization and team to be resilient for the current and future global dynamics as well as business developments.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key-responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Understand the business, internal and external QA developments to pro-actively define and implement food safety, quality and costs performance indicators for suppliers as well as integrate it in the appropriate quality systems and quality processes;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Continuously drive and monitor the performance of your department as well as suppliers using the insights from audits and data analysis;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>As a team member of the Quality Leadership Team, shape, advocate and enable the F&amp;B quality mission, vision and strategy;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Translate this and define the F&amp;B Supplier Quality Management strategy;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lead a global team of 7 QA advisors and functional disciplines and support them in their development to be a resilient team, excited to face all known and unknown challenges;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onboard and align with new suppliers on the F&amp;B way of working as well as invest in building a business relationship with them.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>An organization where we care for our people and find a safe and inclusive environment of the utmost importance;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A dynamic workplace where you get the opportunity to shape and use your creativity to come with solutions that have a direct impact on the business;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A possibility to work in a global setting and team with different cultures and dynamics;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A learning environment where you can develop yourself and your team to the next level;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A competitive salary and renumeration package.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A master’s degree in Food Science and \u002F or Quality Management;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with change management and ability to lead a change;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A real people person, able to connect and collaborate with your internal and external stakeholder as well as being an inspirational people leader;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>At least 8 years’ experience in Quality Assurance or related field within Life Sciences;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge in Quality Management and specific Quality Supplier Management (e.g. FSSC22000, HACCP, ISO, GMP);<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You like to work and communicate with diverse and cross-functional teams, internally and externally;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficient in English, other languages are assets.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What you’ll do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   People make all the difference. Within the Talent Development value stream, the People Performance &amp; Growth team focuses on learning, development, and performance management. We want our employees to become the captain of their own ship, propelled by their desire to learn and grow. We want them to love to learn and own it. Growth happens when you venture out of your comfort zone and try something new. Mistakes are part of learning, and by continuously asking for feedback you grow. You won’t know unless you try. \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Do you want to help us achieve this vision? Do you love to try something new every day? Do you get energy from helping others grow and spark their enthusiasm for learning? Do you get excited about getting into action, so people can bring their best self to work every day and deliver great performance? Then this your next challenge!\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Within our People &amp; Organization (P&amp;O) function the global Talent value stream drives a contemporary, integrated, and inclusive talent agenda. We increase employee ownership over their performance, learning and career development. Talent Development is about empowering our people to develop the skills required to build a sustainable future, and we move away from focusing on box-ticking and processes.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   You will be part of the global Employee Performance &amp; Growth team (in the Talent value stream) and report directly to the Global Lead Onboarding &amp; Learning.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>During your internship of ideally 4-6 months (starting in January 2023 or later), you will get the opportunity to make an impact in different exciting initiatives that drive learning culture and people performance at DSM, such as culture change, rethinking onboarding, people development and performance management, helping us shape the future of work at DSM and create a great employee experience. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>In case you need to complete a school assignment during your internship, you will be able to dedicate 50% of your time to the assignment, and 50% to work in our team.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You can bring your own strengths to the team, and you get the chance to achieve own learning goals related to our key initiatives<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You will collaborate with people across the whole company to understand their needs and create a great employee experience for them related to people performance and development.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The chance to try something new every day and experience what it is like to support all employees of a global organization in their learning, development, and performance management<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The opportunity to make an impact by contributing to our global initiatives<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A hybrid workplace that offers flexibility to employees across the business<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A team of diverse employees who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A truly global, diverse, and collaborative team that cares about the experience of our employees<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The encouragement you need to develop and achieve<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A caring and supportive environment where you’re empowered to grow and share your ideas<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Currently doing a Bachelor or Master degree (relevant disciplines like Human Resources, Business Administration, or Social Sciences are an advantage)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Expertise in Learning &amp; Development, Performance Management, Change Management, Communications, HR Technology \u002F People Analytics are an advantage<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Team player with strong collaboration skills<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Connecting to people gives you energy<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong communication skills<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Solid project management skills<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong problem solving and analytical skills, design thinking \u002F user centric mindset<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Digital savvy (HR Technology, Microsoft 365, Adobe Suite is an advantage)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic skills in data analytics in MS Excel<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to combine a global and local mindset<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Fluent in English, both in writing and verbally<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Our recruitment process<\u002Fb>\n   <br> Interested in this position? Due to privacy regulations, we can only actively interact with applications via our career portal.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div>\n   Please note that you have to be enrolled in university\u002Fhigher education throughout the internship period. Internship applicants must also be able to obtain a third-party signature by their University Supervisor to be eligible to have an Internship Contract with DSM. Therefore, the internship must be formally recognized and advocated by the University or Institution.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   For further information, please contact:\n   <br> Maciej Madanowski, Recruiter (maciej.madanowski@dsm.com)\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Hybrid work location – Delft, NL<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   To reinforce our team, we are looking for an enthusiastic and committed\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>Associate Scientist Enzyme Analytics<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What you’ll do:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Working on the interface between Enzyme development and developing the tools to work on the science behind our enzyme products, your focus will be on supporting the Food innovation projects with your biochemical expertise. We look for someone that can strengthen our knowledge in the broader enzyme analysis field and understanding of our enzymes. Your daily work will be composed of (giving guidance to) practical work in the lab, and of active contributions in projects to develop new products. You will use your expertise to give analytical support to improve production processes and give support to questions arising from the market. Therefore, the ability to translate your enzyme knowledge and know-how to non-scientists, e.g., via interaction with our customers, is a plus. \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   To facilitate all this, you will work in multidisciplinary project teams with, Genetics, Fermentation and Down-Stream Processing, Application, IP, Regulatory and Bio IT experts, to ensure the right analytical techniques are met and to facilitate to create new and improve existing DSM products.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM is strongly committed to act as a solution provider to the customers it services. This implies that besides the focus on DSM ingredients you will need to understand the products and processes of our customers while being able to include external complementary solutions. DSM is continuously tackling some of the world’s greatest challenges, creating brighter lives for all. You are expected to actively participate in enabling the expansion of DSM’s solutions!\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>We are looking for someone with a M.Sc. degree or comparable level in the field of biochemistry, food chemistry biotechnology or equivalent, with several years of experience working in enzyme analysis.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You have a strong affinity towards lab and or data automation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with, or clear eagerness to learn in-depth characterization and quantification of enzymes in a complex matrix is preferred <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Hands-on experience with Enzymology and or Biochemistry technology platforms <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Have experience with other analytical methods (e.g., Chromatography, NMR, LC-MS)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You are able to work on multiple projects. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>You can apply your scientific knowledge and expertise in providing practical and\u002For create innovative solutions while being able to clearly present the added value of your contributions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>We expect you to be a team player eager to connect to fellow professionals in the various scientific competence areas within DSM as well as to those from external parties.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You have a customer focus, and you are open to share knowledge with your colleagues. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>You have a flair for communicating data and results at the relevant level: both to your colleagues but also to non-experts<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Your personality can be described as collaborative, entrepreneurial, pro-active, responsible, result-driven and flexible. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Good communication skills in English are required.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About the organization<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The DSM Science &amp; Innovation community is made up of creative thinkers, who thrive in fast-paced environments and continually come up with innovative solutions to meet the changing needs of our customers. Through collaborating with people in different fields and not being afraid to try new things, we innovate exciting new products, processes, and solutions. In this collaboration, data and knowledge-driven insights which are unlocked through digital and analytical tools and technologies are key.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The R&amp;D Center for Food Innovation (CFI) works for our Business Group Food &amp; Beverages (F&amp;B). We bring together knowledge from consumer, markets, science, and technology to create DSM’s innovations in the Food &amp; Beverages area. \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   You will work in a team of talented scientists and technicians with a strong expertise in developing enzymatic analysis to characterize (novel) enzyme products and enable the development of enzyme products for the Food &amp; Beverage industry. There is a strong link with the Innovation, application, and operations teams. As Associate Responsible Scientist Enzyme Analytics you will be responsible to design the strategy to get the right analytics in place to enable successful development, scale up and implementation of our enzymatic products.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume in English via our career portal. The procedure will generally be in line with the DSM application process outlined on the DSM career website. Due to privacy regulations, we can only actively interact with applications via our career portal.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   For further information, please contact Tetiana Milewska, Talent Acquisition Business Partner tetiana.milewska@dsm.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. Vanzelfsprekend staat de veiligheid van jezelf en je collega’s altijd voorop (I care, we care). Je rapporteert aan de Productieleider Poly en bent een voorbeeld in gedrag en woord.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Kerntaken<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Hiërarchisch leidinggeven aan je team en verantwoordelijk voor de performance van je medewerkers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Het actief ontwikkelen van competenties (gedrag, kennis en vaardigheden) van je team(leden).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>(Mede-)verantwoordelijk voor de duurzame inzetbaarheid van je teamleden, -ontwikkeling en het verbeteren van de individuele- en teamprestatie.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Het zoeken naar nieuwe mogelijkheden tot optimalisatie van resultaten en het bewaken van de continuïteit, zowel korte als middellange termijn. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Bepalen van prioriteiten, structureren, regelen van teamactiviteiten, geven van aanwijzingen, oplossen van niet routinematige problemen en begeleiden van de oplossing daarvan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Aanwezig zijn op de werkvloer om de norm te stellen en te verbinden.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Zorgdragen voor goede overdracht in woord en schrift.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uitvoeren van administratieve werkzaamheden en verwerken van data in systemen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Het voorleven en uitvoeren van <b>World Class SHE cultuur<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Risicobewust opstellen en controleren van werkvergunningen en overbruggingen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Een correcte uitvoering van de dagelijkse Manufex loop.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Verantwoordelijk voor de operationele inbreng in projecten en verbeteringen.<\u002Fli> \n de DSM-cultuur kompas.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Beschikt aantoonbaar over de competenties: samenwerken, besluitvaardig, resultaatgericht, goede oordeel- en besluitvorming, coachen, goede mondelinge en schriftelijke communicatie.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Weet te verbinden en heeft leidinggevende en organisatorische vaardigheden.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Beschikt over het juiste abstractieniveau en systeemdenken. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Supply Chain Manager<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   <b>Explore possibilities. Besides that, one of your responsibilities will be giving input to definition of inventory levels and defining stock policies in agreement with business management. At this role you’ll report to Global Supply Planning Manager. We offer a hybrid workplace with the office located in \n   <b>Geleen<\u002Fb>.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <i>Are you interested to help us achieve our goals? With a global turnover of more than €1M and over 1700 employees, DEM is one of the prominent suppliers of Engineering Plastics worldwide. DEM material solutions can be found in many products with the Electronics, Automotive or General Industries. Sales offices and representatives are located at almost all major countries in Europe, Asia Pacific, and the USA.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The markets in which DEM operates are very dynamic with customers who use complex value chains and focus more and more on global approach. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   DSM Food &amp; Beverage is a leading global supplier of food enzymes, cultures, taste and health ingredients and other specialties for the many of the leading global and local dairy, baking, beverages and savory food brands. Our advanced ingredients help our customers to differentiate their products with great taste, texture and appearance and optimize their production processes by reducing raw material usage, waste, emissions and energy need.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Today, within the DSM F&amp;B Dairy, Baking &amp; Beverage team, we have a vacancy for the position of:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Account Manager Cheese – the Netherlands<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What You’ll do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   What drives our customers is the starting point of what we do. To help them deliver and find new value is central to how we work. We are alert and curious by nature – with the ability to identify and translate what we see happening in the market and with the consumer into opportunities for our customers that create wellbeing for all.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   For the Netherlands we are looking for an Account Manager Cheese. In this position you will be home based but travel between 50-70% of your time to visit our clients. You will report directly to the Regional Sales Manager.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   As the Account Manager Cheese you develop, implement and realize the account strategy and plan, within the sales strategy and plan and corporate requirements and guidelines, in order to ensure the realization of planned business results and long-term customer relationship objectives are achieved.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key-responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>To set up, coordinate &amp; execute specific Accounts tactics &amp; plans to realize pre-defined\u002Fagreed sales and overall customer relationship objectives, both for the short- and long term;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Define and implement a strategic account plan. Translate into Financial profitability and goals both strategically and tactically and be accountable for top line profit;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Contribute to develop the sales plan, both strategically and tactically;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitor and coordinate the execution of the account plan, report based on defined performance indicators and take corrective actions, in order to achieve the results;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Build sustainable cross layer networks in the defined accounts by both direct engagement and by positioning key stakeholders to the right level in the account to speed up development and brick wall running business;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Identify long term business opportunities with the account(s) and include these in the account strategy and plan;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Define and implement projects with focus on key products, processes and innovation, and decide on clear PMP structure and accountabilities;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitor and benchmark competitive products, market requirements and competitive business strategies (competitive profiling) and incorporate benchmarking and competitive profiling in account and sales plans;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lead contract negotiations with the respective account(s) and ensure the conclusion of sales contracts;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinate technical service or after sales service activities towards the account;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitor the complaint process and ensure an appropriate complaint settlement with the account within the agreed timeline;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitor the account’s payment behavior and act to ensure payment within the agreed payment terms.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The chance to shape DSM and its impact for years to come;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A hybrid workplace that offers flexibility to employees across the business;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A team of diverse employees who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A truly global and collaborative team that cares about the experience of our employees;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The encouragement you need to develop and achieve;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A role that is highly visible and allows you to build your brand;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A caring and supportive environment where you’re empowered to grow and share your ideas;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A supportive environment where you’re empowered to grow and share your ideas;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A safe, inclusive workplace where you feel welcome.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor or Master degree or equivalent in science, technology or other business related field;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proven experience in Account Management in an international business-to-business environment in the Cheese industry;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ideally have extensive knowledge and understanding of Cheese cultures and enzymes and\u002For other Dairy ingredients with a strong ability to describe and discuss the products in depth;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Preferably have an existing network within the international Cheese industry;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrated successful achievements within sales\u002Fcommerce;<\u002Fli> \n kinds of people;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong drive for results, customer focus and are ambitious;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent communicator and have good planning and organizational skills;<\u002Fli> \n You are therefore in charge of overall local management, direction and execution of, safety health and environmental programs, quality &amp; food safety programs, capital projects and facilities.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Next to this you will be accountable for developing and meeting forecasted production, volume, efficiency, cost targets and capital expenditure plans as well as accountability for employee development and performance management. You also act as DSM representative for the plant towards authorities. You lead a team of 75-80 people.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <i>Site Manufacturing:<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Identify &amp; analyze potential operational &amp; SHE risks and implement measures to meet business objectives;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Define &amp; implement a Site manufacturing plan in order to ensure production &amp; delivery of products in line with agreed planning and specifications;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitor the execution of the Site manufacturing plan &amp; take corrective actions when necessary;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop, maintain &amp; manage contacts with governmental organizations in order to obtain and safeguard short term and long-term license-to-operate &amp; business continuity;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop, implement &amp; manage a cost effective &amp; efficient site organization in order to drive and continuously improve the business contribution through the Site Leadership Team.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <i>Policies, KPI’s and Systems:<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Manage, coach &amp; motivate Site employees and management team;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure formulation, approval and management of the yearly cost budget for site;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure definition and implementation of lagging and leading performance indicators and periodical reporting of actual performance against these indicators, in order to facilitate (timely) decision taking;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure implementation of SHEQ structures and systems, in line with ANH business and DSM corporate SHEQ guidelines and systems, in order to meet legal and DSM requirements, to guarantee the quality of processes and products, to ensure the license to operate and a safe and healthy working place;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Steer the overall performance of the plant and drive its Continuous Improvement ambitions.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <i>Employee development and performance:<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Coach and mentor team members to ensure they perform and develop in a manner consistent with company expectations;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage the performance of direct report employees by creating development opportunities, ensuring suitable training and performing annual performance and development reviews.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <i>Safety Health and Environment:<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Lead the development of an effective safety culture and behaviors to ensure that self and others go home safe each day;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follow all SHE instructions and procedures to include ensuring awareness of and following all DSM Life Saving Rules;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure that all personal safety, quality and assigned training is up to date and in compliance;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure that the competences of the employees are sufficient to let them perform their task in a SHE responsible way;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support and follow the policy of reporting incidents, near misses and improvement possibilities.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The freedom to be creative and proactive;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A hybrid workplace that offers flexibility to employees across the business;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>We offer you the possibility to grow and develop yourself professionally and personally;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A team of diverse employees who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A truly global and collaborative team that cares about the experience of our employees.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>University degree in process (or other) engineering, or science, or MBA, or equivalents required;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>8 -10 years operations supervision and management experience, preferably in a food \u002F animal nutrition related plant;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrated ability to develop local business plans, measures and objectives based on overall corporate goals and directives;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrated ability to direct and lead people in the accomplishment of business objectives in a fast-moving environment through change;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrated skills in the areas of customer focus and achieving business results;<\u002Fli> people and coaching skills and leads by example.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The ANH Premix Plant in Stroe, part of a strategic acquisition by DSM in late 2017, represents the largest premix production capacity in the EMEA Region. The site has a long history of serving customers since 1930 and has been substantially redeveloped and expanded, most recently in 2016. Production is carried out through a number of powder mixing lines which operate on a shift basis, 5 days per week.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   No matter which team you are on, at DSM you’ll be part of a powerful shared purpose – to create brighter lives for all. You’ll get opportunities to work collaboratively with different departments and industry experts to make a positive difference to the future of millions of people and the planet we all share. Together, we’ll understand the needs of every customer and offer solutions that promote their success and impact, today and in the future.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Category Manager – Geleen, NL<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>The Challenge<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The Global Procurement department of DSM Engineering Materials* (DEM) manages the raw material flow and is accountable for purchasing strategy, contract management and pricing\u002Fpurchase requisition with DEM’s organization. We are looking for exceptional candidates to join the team in the capacity of Procurement Contract Manager. This position will implement and realize the strategy for Direct Spend for the Category, within corporate requirements and guidelines, in order to ensure results on all KPI’s as defined within DEM, and to contribute to the overall result for DSM. There will be 10-20% travel, which could including international travel.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>The Position<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Contribute to the Direct Spend strategy development and represent Direct Spend in the Category.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop and deploy vision and approved plan for his\u002Fher Category.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lead development and implementation of the strategy for Direct Spend in the Category and assign priorities for sourcing projects\u002Fresponsible for category strategy development.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Define and validate the global sourcing strategy for the Category, using Strategic Sourcing Methodology (SSM).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Take a strategic and long-term view of DEM Purchasing in identifying and developing innovative sources and contractual arrangements. Accountable for internal and external analysis in collaboration with Contract Managers, as chairman of a cross-functional sourcing team.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepare and lead fact based negotiation and select strategic suppliers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Direct contract implementation activity with regional contract managers and resolve issues.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage\u002Fevaluate contract compliance, and supplier performance and take necessary corrective actions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop and ensure implementation of risk mitigation strategy in the various regions .<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participate in supplier audits with Supplier Quality Manager.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Key account management for Key suppliers\u002FDevelop and manage relationship with key suppliers and track their performance.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>The Ideal<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Education requirement: Bachelor’s degree in an Engineering and\u002For business discipline (Master’s degree preferred).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5–8 years of experience in supply chain and\u002For procurement with a global company.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>B2B experience a strong plus.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Energetic, self-starter with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Result-oriented and strong analytical skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong systems knowledge, including reporting tools like SAP, SAP BW, and MS Office Suite.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills, as well as, relationship building skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>The Reward<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and solving the challenges of today’s world. Challenging jobs, career opportunities and an inspiring environment allow you to enhance your personal development. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team competencies and performance.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Procedure &amp; Contact<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? railway and other specialty businesses in a safe and sustainable way.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment Driven by an understanding of end-to-end HR processes and systems, a tiered model of operation and in collaboration with the Regional Relationship Manager and other HRSS team members, the Payroll Specialist is challenged to ensure stable execution of Payroll processes in the region, with a continuous focus on service improvements. In this key role, it is critical to manage &amp; communicate effectively with Stakeholders, understand end to end HR processes\u002F systems and participate in projects sometimes around ambiguous circumstances.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Realize HR specialist activities in the assigned specialist areas, countries or processes;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Be constantly aware of efficiencies or improvement in the activities performed and\u002For the work processes;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure that activities are compliant within the DSM guidelines and as needed local (legal) legislation and practices;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure a smooth process between payroll and finance general ledger to have payroll posted perfectly so that finance is able to reconcile posting, declaration and payments;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Act as a liaison between P&amp;O stakeholders and Tier 2 support activities, to ensure smooth interaction between P&amp;O stakeholders (e.g. managers, employees, PST) and HRSS;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepare relevant analytics &amp; reports as needed by the client &amp; manage data input based on standardized processes &amp; controls;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Give advice on policy implementation or execution based on expertise HR policies, processes, programs and tools are optimally implemented and up-to-date;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Tier 2 support activities * Maintain an appropriate level of knowledge on DSM relevant business &amp; content.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   We offer a challenging job at our world-leading R&amp;D organization, fully supporting DSM’s purpose-led, performance driven strategy, high employee engagement figures and opportunity for working with the top of external and internal experts. You will work in a company with an international reputation as sustainability leader. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team performance.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The freedom to be creative and proactive;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A hybrid workplace that offers flexibility to employees across the business;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>We offer you the possibility to grow and develop yourself professionally and personally;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A team of diverse employees who are not afraid to think outside of the box;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A truly global and collaborative team that cares about the experience of our employees.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>At Minimum, bachelor’s degree in human resources management, Business, Finance or related discipline;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 or more years of experience in Human Resources Operations, including HRIS, payroll and time and attendance;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central preferred;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Exceptional adherence to detail, efficiency and accuracy;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A courageous team member who embraces change and new ideas;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Enthusiastic collaborator who works to find solutions together;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Be able to work under tight deadlines, with flexibility;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good reporting analytics skills;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent problem solving\u002Ftroubleshooting skills;<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to identify and drive continuous improvements.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   HR Shared Service (HRSS) is one of the building blocks of the P&amp;O operating model and serves all employees and managers, globally. HRSS is accountable to put in place a future proof, efficient and scalable organization, with a Global Service Center for transactional activities, a Service Desk for employee enquiries and customer-facing satellite teams in key locations. On both a global and regional level, HRSS leads transactional activities, employee data management, payroll, reporting, learning, compensation &amp; benefits administration, digitization of the P&amp;O processes and vendor management. HRSS can provide a (tech-enabled) employee experience that, through its simplicity and automation, drives value for all our stakeholders.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div>\n   DSM is globally reversing the outsourcing of all Employee Data Management processes. The design of the new way of working and the global roll out hereof have been brought together in Project Centrex. All Employee Data Management processes will be brought together and managed in the Employee Central Module, that will be integrated into Success Factors\u002FTalent Suite.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   No matter which team you are on, at DSM you’ll be part of a powerful shared purpose – to create brighter lives for all. You’ll get opportunities to work collaboratively with different departments and industry experts to make a positive difference to the future of millions of people and the planet we all share. Together, we’ll understand the needs of every customer and offer solutions that promote their success and impact, today and in the future.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Please be so kind to use the link provided.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   For further information you can contact, Martin Zwart, Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner (martin.zwart@dsm.com).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   A Pre-Employment Screening, reference check procedures and assessment can be part of the recruitment process. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Supply Chain Manager<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   <b>Explore possibilities. Besides that, one of your responsibilities will be giving input to definition of inventory levels and defining stock policies in agreement with business management. At this role you’ll report to Global Supply Planning Manager. We offer a hybrid workplace with the office located in \n   <b>Geleen<\u002Fb>.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <i>Are you interested to help us achieve our goals? Do you have an improvement mindset and know-how? Are you ready to develop and maintain new optimization concepts? Then this your next challenge!<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <i><br> <\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Leading the planning process in the development of a plan encompassing the agreed sales, supply, and inventory plans, to meet the short- and medium-term policies of the business for coming 24 months.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Leading monthly IBP demand process to have agreed sales plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Providing input to S&amp;OP meeting with “what if” scenarios to the proposed plan and simulate the effect of various alternatives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensuring the effective execution of the S&amp;O planning process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensuring an accurate supply planning process and finalizing the master production schedule.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Engineering Materials (DEM) produces and sells a broad assortment of engineering plastics in the market segments Automotive, Electrical &amp; Electronics, Specialty Industries, Extrusion\u002FPackaging and Distribution. With a global turnover of more than €1M and over 1700 employees, DEM is one of the prominent suppliers of Engineering Plastics worldwide. DEM material solutions can be found in many products with the Electronics, Automotive or General Industries. Sales offices and representatives are located at almost all major countries in Europe, Asia Pacific, and the USA.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The markets in which DEM operates are very dynamic with customers who use complex value chains and focus more and more on global approach. Professionals of DE intercept on technology, application, and total cost of semi and\u002For product. For more information, please visit www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A team of diverse employees who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The encouragement you need to develop and achieve the goals you set.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A dynamic work environment with an experienced supporting team.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The chance to move along and develop yourself in constantly growing industry and to make a difference for our stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Master’s degree, preferably in supply chain management, logistics or purchasing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Around 5 years of relevant experience in a large international company, ideally within Supply Chain Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Familiarity with ERP and SAP systems is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A lean six sigma green belt\u002Fblack belt qualification and SAP IBP experience will be a plus.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Capability to make deep-dive analysis whilst maintaining top-level overview regarding problem &amp; solutions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to organize, act under high pressure whilst driving for results.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Decision making skills and customer focus mindset.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Pro-active and “can do” approach.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communication skills in both English and Dutch.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Our recruitment processes<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Sounds interesting? <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global science-based company active in health, nutrition and materials. DSM delivers innovative solutions that nourish, protect and improve performance in global markets such as food and dietary supplements, personal care, feed, medical devices, automotive, paints, electrical and electronics, life protection, alternative energy and bio-based materials.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Expert Chromatography<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   <b>Drive improvements. Develop concepts.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What you’ll do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   At this role you will work in the Research and Technology department on solving both short- and long-term problems in the field of chromatography (both liquid and gas) of engineering polymers. You will tackle customer questions with a scientific approach utilizing your understanding of polymer characterization. As an expert, you will identify the problems brought to you by the Business and you will cooperate with other experts to find solutions through experimental work. Moreover, your analysis will guide the development of products and applications for DSM Engineering Materials. You will be stimulated and coached to develop yourself in both the business and scientific projects, as well as on your personal skills like entrepreneurship, communication, and leadership. At this position you will report to R&amp;T Manager Analytics. We offer a hybrid workplace with the office located in \n   <b>Geleen<\u002Fb>.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Working on short- and long-term projects to fulfill urgent customer needs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Developing new competences in characterization of polymers via technologies like liquid chromatography with mass spectrometry and gas chromatography.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working on new technological developments in chromatography and quantification of polymers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Timely identifying and resolving instrumental issues to ensure operational excellence.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Making expertise know-how available, ensuring that the respective competence delivers a high-end result to the projects.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participating in the projects by setting up and executing the required experiments in a safe, reliable, and accurate way. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Reporting and presenting the acquired knowledge of the different experiments to the project team.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Contributing to projects by participating in project teams as a team member, both by performing experiments but also by guiding the process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Indicating solutions to keep developments and production ongoing within the defined constraints (money, time) and in compliance with all applicable regulations and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Planning and organizing execution of research activities in the field of responsibility, aligned with the team, Senior Experts and Resource Manager.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Engineering Materials (DEM) produces and sells a broad assortment of engineering plastics in the market segments Automotive, Electrical &amp; Electronics, Specialty Industries, Extrusion\u002FPackaging and Distribution. With a global turnover of more than €1M and over 1700 employees, DEM is one of the prominent suppliers of Engineering Plastics worldwide. DEM material solutions can be found in many products with the Electronics, Automotive or General Industries. Sales offices and representatives are located at almost all major countries in Europe, Asia Pacific, and the USA.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The markets in which DEM operates are very dynamic with customers who use complex value chains and focus more and more on global approach. Professionals of DE intercept on technology, application, and total cost of semi and\u002For product. For more information, please visit www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A team of diverse employees who are not afraid to think outside of the box.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A truly global and collaborative team that cares about the experience of our customers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The encouragement you need to develop and achieve the goals you set.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A caring and supportive environment where you’re empowered to grow and share your ideas.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Challenging and rewarding job in a team of highly professional peers within an innovative global company with lots of opportunities for personal development.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Master’s degree or higher with a background in analytical chemistry, particularly in chromatography of polymers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in analytical methods development.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>At least two years’ experience in an industrial R&amp;D setting.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work in multi-functional teams.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good planning skills and capabilities in Project Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good social and communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Practical, enthusiastic, proactive, and flexible attitude.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Our recruitment processes<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Within F&amp;B, the Central Master Data Management Team sets and maintains the standards, processes, KPI’s and MD-settings with the purpose of maintaining and improving high quality Master Data. All supported by appropriate tooling. Having high quality master data is the prerequisite for optimal functioning of business processes leading to optimum use of operational and management reporting.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   In this position, you will act as a Global Master Data Manager for all initiatives\u002Fprojects\u002Fissues related to Master Data in SAP Systems or related databases. You will monitor and continuously improve F&amp;B’s Master Data quality, completeness, and consistency in line with the defined F&amp;B standards. In addition, you will lead a team of Master Data Experts that provide data management services. This team is responsible to define, monitor, help to maintain and continuously improve the quality, completeness, and consistency of the Master Data in various applications.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>You get the possibility to be the go to person for master data quality within DSM Food &amp; Beverages.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You can further develop your leadership and managerial skills<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A dynamic work environment with many challenges that give you the possibility to work autonomously and with a team in finding the right solutions. You are giving the freedom to be creative and proactive.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>An inclusive and multicultural team with respect for everyone.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>We offer you the possibility to grow and develop yourself professionally and personally.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A good Collective Labor Agreement and competitive salary.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Besides 25 paid holidays plus budget to buy additionally up to 13 extra holidays.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Based on your experience we will offer you a base salary of 80K to 115K per year (including holiday allowance and 13th month) and extra benefits, such as 25 holiday days, a bonus, the option to buy more holiday days with a 6% my choice budget and much more.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div>\n   Below please find the Key-Responsibilities and Requirements for competences and experience in more detail.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Your key areas of accountability\u002Fresponsibilities will be to:\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Implement F&amp;B’s Master Data Management strategy and keep communicating and explaining the data vision across the Business Group<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Translate the F&amp;B goals into specific actions and business plans and define data improvement initiatives<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintain a Business Group harmonized governance model for Masterdata Management, including harmonization and standardization across businesses, regions and processes<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support Strategic Master Data owners on the importance, impact, business benefits and responsibilities of good master data management<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lead and coach a team of MDM experts (10 FTE)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Act as primary point of contact within F&amp;B for the Global Master Data team with Global Digital Services.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Establish and maintain processes to ensure master data availability, completeness, accuracy, and integrity<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure continuous improvement of master data quality, ao via KPI-reports on master data quality<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Responsible for projects from a master data management perspective, e.g. activities that derive from mergers and acquisitions.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Have a Master degree in business administration, Data Science or related or a Bachelor degree with additional years of relevant experience<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Have at least 5 years’ experience in Master Data Management including Master Data Governance and Data Quality<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Have solid experience in SAP<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Have managerial experience or proven leadership qualities<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Have the ability to connect with and translate complex technical subjects to all levels of business users<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Have the ability and stamina to consistently safeguard, promote, explain and defend the quality of Masterdata in F&amp;B<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Are pragmatic, result driven and organizational structures, business processes, and their interdependencies<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Are able to be in Delft-office 3 days per week (you may work from home 2 days per week)<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <b>When you apply for the vacancy, please clearly indicate for each of the areas above, what your experience and knowledge is.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Supply Chain<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   No matter which team you are on, at DSM you’ll be part of a powerful shared purpose – to create brighter lives for all. Together, we’ll understand the needs of every customer and offer solutions that promote their success and impact, today and in the future.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>How to apply<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? That’s why our vision is to Enable Better Food for Everyone.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   What drives our customers is the starting point of what we do. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Project Engineer Electrical &amp; Instrumentation<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>Drive improvement. Monitor performance.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What you’ll do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   As the Project Engineer you are contributing to the optimization and improvement of the plants by executing en coordinating projects to establish safe design, operation, optimization plant stability and improvement of production plants. By providing broad and in-depth project engineering expertise in your field in all phases of the projects. In this role you will report to the Sr. Project &amp; Portfolio Manager. We offer a hybrid workplace with the office located in \n   <b>Emmen<\u002Fb>.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <i>Are you a person driven by a continuous improvement mindset? Are you a real team player building strong relationship with disciplines within different backgrounds to realize an effective approach and realization of projects and feasibility studies? Do you have strong customer focus and communicator on all levels and are you a sparring partner for peers and stakeholders? Then apply now!<\u002Fi>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Responsible for input of appropriate professional engineering knowledge in your field in all phases of projects. For specific monodisciplinary projects in your field of expertise you will also lead the projects yourself.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensuring that projects run within budget, on time and accident-free.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Taking on time pro-active, corrective actions when quality, SHE or costs are at stake.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Providing engineering expertise in large capital and improvement projects. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>You will document, file, and ensure on time and accurate communication to the stakeholders.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You will be responsible for and leading contractors.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensuring the integrity of process and equipment in terms of SHE and Q as project result.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluating the effectiveness of the executed projects and define corrective actions if necessary.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Promoting a positive SHE mindset internal and external in compliance with all regulations, and a proactive approach towards SHE, focused on monitoring unsafe situations.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About us<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Engineering Materials is a global supplier of high-performance engineering thermoplastic solutions. It has a focused portfolio, with global leadership positions in many of its products such as Stanyl®, Arnitel® Akulon® and Arnite®. DSM Engineering Materials addresses key markets in automotive and electronics, and provides solutions to specialized industries including water management, breathable textiles, and flexible food packaging. Our products are very technical with a broad range of specifications and potential application areas. We sell into dynamic target markets with customers operating in complex value chain contexts and with an increasingly global approach. At DSM Engineering Materials, we make bold progress and put customers first. You are invited: bring your passion and build the future!\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>The opportunity to identify value and generate opportunities within our production facility in Emmen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A team of diverse employees who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Global and multidisciplinary collaboration between other production facilities of DEM and the Innovation department.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The encouragement you need to develop and achieve.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A role in which you can make an actual difference by driving continuous improvement strategies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A caring and supportive environment where you’re empowered to grow and share your ideas.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor or master’s degree in Electrical\u002FInstrumentation Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum of 5 years of work experience in operations, engineering, or project engineering within the process industry.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proven project engineering, problem solving and analytical skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in project management in an operational environment preferable as project leader.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Technical engineering knowledge of the plant and the process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good command of the Dutch, German, and English language or willing to learn.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Our recruitment processes<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Interested in this position? Apply by uploading your CV and motivation letter in English on the DSM career website (www.dsm.com\u002Fcareers).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The procedure will generally be in line with the DSM application process outlined on the DSM career website. Due to privacy regulations, we can only actively interact with applications via our career portal.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   For further information, please contact Ignacy Cieślik, Talent Acquisition Business Partner (ignacy.cieslik@dsm.com).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Pre-employment screenings are part of the DSM Recruitment &amp; Selection Process.
